title: [Core] Don't divide zero by zero
body:
I was getting crashes here with floating point exceptions enabled.

This may not be a good fix but at least the resulting layout looks fine again, I can put together a repro if you think this is the wrong way to do it.
author: mikejsavage

comments.body: Hey @mikejsavage, thanks for the good catch! I actually noticed another bug related to downsizing when I was investigating thing, would you be able to try out my change and confirm it fixes your bug correctly? 🙂
Yep your change works too, and produces identical results to what I tried

satisfaction_conditions: Prevents division-by-zero errors in layout calculations
Maintains correct layout results after fix
Validated through testing with real-world scenarios

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM ubuntu:latest

# Install system dependencies required for building the project
RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y \
    git \
    build-essential \
    cmake \
    libsdl2-dev \
    libsdl2-ttf-dev && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Clone repository and checkout specific commit with the fix
RUN git clone https://github.com/nicbarker/clay.git /clay && \
    cd /clay && \
    git checkout 39c2aa530544eaed349a966d253c4d3c5a1395bb

# Create build directory and build project using CMake
WORKDIR /clay/build
RUN cmake .. && \
    make
